steps.content: â€œPogâ€ is a slang term on Twitch thatâ€™s short for â€œplay of the game.â€ Gamers and Twitch viewers use â€œPogâ€ to express surprise, amazement, or excitement when a player pulls off an impressive or unexpected move. Saying or calling something â€œPogâ€ is like saying somethingâ€™s good, remarkable, or well done. [1] X Research source Variations: â€œPogs,â€ â€œPoggers,â€ â€œPogU,â€ â€œPogChamp,â€ and the â€œPogChampâ€ emote (an animated emoticon featuring streamer Ryan â€œGootecksâ€ Gutierrez making a bewildered face). How to use: Send â€œPogâ€ or the â€œPogChampâ€ emote on Twitch to show support or excitement, or on other platforms when somethingâ€™s excellent or impressive. Examples: That assist was pog! Can I get some pogs in the chat? POGGERS! My first birthday gift came early. Pog! He keeps pogging the chat. This week is looking pretty pog ğŸ˜

steps.content: â€œPogâ€ comes from the original â€œPogChampâ€ emote (2010). The emote was taken from an outtakes video uploaded by Cross Counters TV that featured champion gamers Ryan â€œGootecksâ€ Gutierrez and Mike Ross. In the video, Gutierrez made several wild and surprised facial expressions that turned into popular reaction memes and emotes on Twitch, the most well-known being the â€œPogChampâ€ emote. â€œPogUâ€ is another emote that came from the same outtakes video. The original â€œPogChampâ€ emote was pulled from Twitch on January 6, 2021 after Gutierrez made comments about the Capitol Riots that Twitch deemed as inciting violence. [2] X Research source The emote now features the faces of various other streamers.
